title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 2 ยง 333.1 - Background
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 2 ยง 333.1 - Background

State Regulations

Sections
61-a
and
361-a
of the Retirement and Social

Security Law, as added by chapter 602 of the Laws of 1978, provide for the
payment of interest for unpaid accidental and ordinary death benefits, to
accrue from the date of death of the member until payment is made. These
sections direct that the amount of interest shall be at the rate provided for
by section
3-a
(1)
of the General Municipal Law. Section
3-a
(1)
of the General Municipal Law, as amended
by chapter 681 of the Laws of 1982, provides for a rate of interest that shall
not exceed three percent per annum prior to April 1, 1983, and for a rate of
interest that shall not exceed nine percent per annum commencing April 1, 1983. The Retirement System has paid, and will continue to pay, the maximum three
percent per annum interest on unpaid death benefits of a member whose death
occurs prior to April 1, 1983. This Part is promulgated to provide for an
increase in the rate of interest on the unpaid death benefits of any member
whose death occurs on or after April 1, 1983. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 2
ยง
333.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
